words.etymology_text: < Finnish Swedish knallhatt (“bowler hat”) < knallhatt (“old word for detonator, now tändhatt”); in Sweden bowler hat is plommonstop or kubb

raw_glosses: (nautical) cleat (two-armed mounting onto which a rope can be tied)
glosses: cleat (two-armed mounting onto which a rope can be tied)

examples.text: Napoleonin syntymävuosi on pelkkä knoppi—etenkin, jos ei ymmärrä hänen vaikutustaan historiassa.
examples.english: Napoleon’s birth year is a mere triviality—especially if one does not understand his influence in history.

glosses: trivia, triviality, detail (insignificant item of unimportant information, especially one assumed useful for passing an exam)

words.etymology_text: Back-formation from knoppologia < Swedish knappologi < knapp (“button”)

Borrowing from Swedish knappologi, coined by August Strindberg in 1884 in his short story De lycksaliges ö in which one of the characters develops a quasiscientific classification system for buttons, knapp in Swedish.

raw_glosses: (skiing, slang) mogul (knoll or mound in a downhill skiing slope)

words.etymology_text: Recent direct loan from English know-how
